intro: Phaca carrizalensis, commonly known as the Carrizalensis phaca, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, showcasing adaptations to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, aiding in water conservation. The flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value.
